intro: Hoya vangviengiensis, commonly known as the Vangvieng hoya, is a rare species of flowering plant native to Laos. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves and clusters of star-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, fragrant blooms that are typically white or pale pink in color. It is a slow-growing epiphytic plant that thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and unique appearance, it is highly sought after by plant enthusiasts and conservationists.
